title: How to Make a Lyric Video for YouTube

steps.title: Decide on a song.
steps.content: Decide on a song. Pick a song that you want to use for your YouTube music video. You'll generally want to pick a song that's popular enough to receive attention, but not so popular that several people have already created lyric videos. Avoid using recently released music, as artists often request that their recent songs be unavailable anywhere but on their official pages.

steps.title: Download the song
steps.content: Download the song if you don't already have it. Purchase the song and download it onto your computer, or download the MP3 version of the song from YouTube. If you're using a Mac, play the song once in order to place it in your iTunes library. Keep in mind that YouTube will often flag music that wasn't purchased as copyright violation.

steps.title: Find the song's lyrics.
steps.content: Find the song's lyrics. The easiest way to find accurate, verified lyrics for your song is by going to the Genius website at https://genius.com/ , entering your song name into the search bar in the top-left corner of the screen, and reviewing the results. You can also just type your song's name and the word "lyrics" (e.g., three little birds lyrics ) into a search engine. Accurate, grammatically correct lyrics generally fare better on YouTube than do inaccurate, misspelled lyrics.

steps.title: Open Windows Movie Maker.
steps.content: Open Windows Movie Maker. Its app icon resembles a film strip. Windows Movie Maker doesn't come packaged with Windows 10, but you can download it from a third-party site. See Download Windows Movie Maker to learn how.

steps.title: Click Title.
steps.content: Click Title . This is in the "Add" section of the toolbar that's at the top of the page.

steps.title: Enter a title for your movie.
steps.content: Enter a title for your movie. Click the text box in the middle of the preview window, press Ctrl + A to select the filler title, type in the title of your lyric video (e.g., the artist and song name), and then click a blank space on the page. You can also select a transition for the title by selecting its slide in the main window, clicking Animations at the top of the page, and selecting an option from the "Transitions" section.

steps.title: Click the Home tab.
steps.content: Click the Home tab. It's in the upper-left corner of the Windows Movie Maker window.

steps.title: Move the placeholder to the right side of the title clip.
steps.content: Move the placeholder to the right side of the title clip. Click and drag the vertical black bar in the main window all the way to the right to do this.

steps.title: Click Add music.
steps.content: Click Add music . It's a box below the blue musical note in the upper-left side of the page. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Add music at the current point….
steps.content: Click Add music at the current point… . This option is in the drop-down menu. A new window will open.

steps.title: Select your song and click Open.
steps.content: Select your song and click Open . Navigate to the song you want to insert, select it, and then click the Open button at the bottom-right corner of the window. Your song will be uploaded to Windows Movie Maker.

steps.title: Click Title again.
steps.content: Click Title again. Doing so will add another title slide to your movie's timeline in the main window.

steps.title: Drag the second title slide to the far-right side of the timeline.
steps.content: Drag the second title slide to the far-right side of the timeline. This should be the title slide that you just added, not the one on which your movie's title is written.

steps.title: Enter the first section of lyrics.
steps.content: Enter the first section of lyrics. Click the second title slide to select it, replace the "My Movie" filler text with your preferred lyrics, and click a blank space on the page. You can adjust the size of the lyrics' text box by clicking and dragging the spheres in the corners and on the sides of the text box.

steps.title: Adjust the lyric slide's duration.
steps.content: Adjust the lyric slide's duration. Double-click the slide that contains lyrics in the main Movie Maker window, then click the "Duration" text box at the top of the page and type in the time in seconds for which the slide should be present. For example, if your lyrics comprise the first ten seconds of the song, you would type 10.0 into the "Duration" text box. You can preview your movie by clicking the "Play" button below the preview window on the left side of the page. This will help you line up your lyrics according to the song's pace.

steps.title: Add more title slides with lyrics.
steps.content: Add more title slides with lyrics. You'll repeat the following steps until you've created lyrics for the entire song: Click Home Click Title Enter lyrics. Adjust the slide's duration.

steps.title: Return to the Home tab and click Save movie.
steps.content: Return to the Home tab and click Save movie . A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Recommended for this project.
steps.content: Click Recommended for this project . It's in the drop-down menu. Doing so opens a Save window.

steps.title: Enter a file name and click Save.
steps.content: Enter a file name and click Save . Type in a name for your movie's file. This is just for your personal use—you'll be able to title the movie differently on YouTube. You can also select a save location (e.g., Desktop ) on the left side of the window before proceeding. The exporting process can take a few minutes.

steps.title: Click Close when prompted.
steps.content: Click Close when prompted. This signifies that your movie has officially been created. You can now proceed to uploading the video to YouTube .

steps.title: Open iMovie.
steps.content: Open iMovie. Its app icon resembles a video camera on a purple star.

steps.title: Click the plus +.
steps.content: Click the plus + . It's above the words "Create New" near the upper-left corner of the window.

steps.title: Click Movie on the menu.
steps.content: Click Movie on the menu.

steps.title: Select a background for the video.
steps.content: Select a background for the video. You can use the Search field at the top-right corner to look for something in particular.

steps.title: Click Create.
steps.content: Click Create . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. A pop-up window will appear.

steps.title: Enter a file name.
steps.content: Enter a file name. Do so in the text box at the top of the pop-up window. If you'd like to change the saving location, you can choose a different folder from the "Where" menu.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's at the bottom-right corner of the pop-up window. This will save your video project.

steps.title: Click the Audio tab.
steps.content: Click the Audio tab. This is the second tab at the top of the window.

steps.title: Search for a song.
steps.content: Search for a song. Type your song's name into the text box at the top of the iTunes section. It will appear in the middle of the left side of the page.

steps.title: Move the song into your video's timeline.
steps.content: Move the song into your video's timeline. Click and drag the song title onto the timeline section at the bottom of the window, then drop it there.

steps.title: Create a title slide.
steps.content: Create a title slide. Click the Titles at the top of the window, click and drag a title from the main window into the timeline, and replace the title slide's filler text with your preferred title (e.g., "Justin Timberlake - What Goes Around Comes Around").

steps.title: Add another title slide.
steps.content: Add another title slide. Click and drag a title slide onto the timeline. This will be your first lyric slide.

steps.title: Enter the first batch of lyrics.
steps.content: Enter the first batch of lyrics. Select the second title slide, then replace its filler text with the lyrics for the first section of the song.

steps.title: Extend the slide to fit the song.
steps.content: Extend the slide to fit the song. Click and drag the vertical bar that's to the right of the lyric title slide in the timeline to the right until it matches up with the last lyric. For example, if your slide's lyrics cover the first ten seconds of the song, you'd want your slide to extend for ten seconds.

steps.title: Add the rest of the lyrics to additional title slides.
steps.content: Add the rest of the lyrics to additional title slides. Repeat the previous steps until you've added all of the song's lyrics.

steps.title: Click the share icon .
steps.content: Click the share icon . It's the square with an upward-pointing arrow at the top-right corner of the window. A menu with icons will expand.

steps.title: Click the File icon.
steps.content: Click the File icon. It looks like a filmstrip. Clicking it prompts a pop-up window.

steps.title: Save your file.
steps.content: Save your file. Click Next... in the pop-up window, select a location on your computer, and then click Save . This will prompt the video to begin saving onto your computer as a file. Once the video finishes saving, you can proceed with uploading it to YouTube .

steps.title: Open YouTube.
steps.content: Open YouTube. Go to https://www.youtube.com/ in your browser. This will open your YouTube home page if you're logged in. If you aren't logged in, click SIGN IN in the upper-right corner, then enter your Google email address and password.

steps.title: Click the "Upload" icon.
steps.content: Click the "Upload" icon. It's an upward-facing arrow in the upper-right side of the page. Doing so opens the uploads page.

steps.title: Click Select files to upload.
steps.content: Click Select files to upload . This is in the middle of the page. Clicking it prompts a window to open.

steps.title: Select your video.
steps.content: Select your video. Click the lyric video to select it. If the window opened to a file location other than the one in which your video is stored, first go to the video's location in the window.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. This will prompt the video to upload to YouTube.

steps.title: Enter a title for your video.
steps.content: Enter a title for your video. In the "My Movie" text box near the top of the page, replace the "My Movie" text with whatever you want to name your lyric video.

steps.title: Add a description and tags if necessary.
steps.content: Add a description and tags if necessary. You can add a description to your lyric video in the "Description" box (this is a good place for artist credit), while you can add tags in the "Tags" text bar.

steps.title: Wait for the video to finish processing.
steps.content: Wait for the video to finish processing. Once the progress bar at the top of the page disappears, you can proceed. Videos can take several minutes to several hours to finish processing, so make sure that your computer is plugged into a power source during this time.

steps.title: Click Publish.
steps.content: Click Publish . It's a blue button in the upper-right side of the page. This will publish your video to your channel. You should now be able to view and share the video from YouTube as you please.
